Joined the military, learned a good trade, met the love of my life, traveled the world, retired and getting paid for the rest of my life!

I actually quit drinking for a while until I got stationed in Germany. I had never had wheat beer before and it was awesome! Now I'm back in the states and German beer is expensive here, it was so cheap over there for the same brands.

I learned that day how to play cool and not let somebody fuck with me, which is what he was trying to do. In the end he got the message I didn't want any trouble but I wasnt scared of his ass either. I rode the bus several times after that and didn't have anymore problems. It was on grey hound between Louisville and Chicago I think.
A person traveling by bus definitely gets to meet all kinds of people.

The hardest part for me is realizing I'm in a downward spiral. Sometimes I won't notice for days. By that time I'm feeling like crap and really don't care to change my mood but then after a while I'll get sick of being in a shitty place and do things to change it. I remind myself that I have won the lottery of life! White American male with a loving wife and kids, what else can you ask for? Also exercise really helps me from starting the spiral to begin with.

I was 19 at the time and riding the bus...Had a big black guy try to intimidate me into giving him my shoes. I was able use humor to get out of the situation...But I also had a big ass knife in my pocket for back up.

I visited part of the Verdun battlefield. There were two occasions where I got the heebeegeebees, first place I was out in the forest where part of the battle had taken place. I found some old period correct ruins of a large building and was checking it out when I heard distant voices talking. It was probably some other people out walking the trails but it was time for me to move on. The second time I was inside Fort Duaumont walking down the empty hallways all alone. I came to an area that had exploded and killed several German soldiers who had been occupying the fort. The atmosphere of the entire place and the echoing sounds of dripping water and muted voices from other tourists who were in other areas was haunting. Unfortunately I didn't have time to, or better yet, didn't want to stop and see the ossuary after being in the fort. I had enough for one day.

This is true. I was stationed in Germany for 4 years and toured WWI and WWII battlefields, went to the Ann Frank House. I'm a history buff and seeing all this stuff was fun. I didn't want to go visit the concentration camps because that would not have been fun and I have seen plenty of documentaries on the subject.
Before you buy a bike make sure you are getting the right size. I don't know anything about either bike but can you find a used bike where you live?
It's like riding a jackhammer if you do it wrong! Good ole taint buster lol!

I started riding back in 97 on a rigid GT Outpost, fully rigid with the crappy old cable brakes not the fancy V brakes. Anyway, I learned how to pick the smooth line (or suffer the consequences) and I've been told on several occasions that I ama very fluid rider. Then I stepped up to a Cannondale with 80mm of front suspension travel and a seatpost shock absorber. Eventually I went FS but I do miss how well you can climb on a hard tail.

$10-$20 tops...Nobody is going to use it, just hang on a wall
Oh yea, forgot to check the sidebar...Lots of great info in there thanks for reminding me!

Heck yea! I got a Minolta Srt 101 off eBay for $35 and a sweet 50mm 1.4 lens for around $25. The camera was made in the late 60's and it still works great! A roll of film costs around $12 and another $13 to develop...so $25 a roll all together which works out to .70 per shot. A new Sony a3000 costs around $600...that's 857 shots on film. I shoot landscape and I don't take the shot unless the conditions are just right so it's going to take me a long time to burn through that much film. If that makes sense.
Thanks for the link!
My local processor wants $25 a roll...Will definitely mail it out! Thanks for the tip!

I'm currently shooting 35mm and have been looking at medium format cameras because of the better resolution for making large prints. I'm tired of digital cameras, they break easily and cost a ton of money. Then you have to mess around in Photoshop for hours on end to make it look close to what you want. I've got an old Minolta Srt 101 that works great and was made in the late 60's and film comes out looking good with no fuss...call me old fashioned. Where is a good place to mail film to get developed? I'm near Ft Worth TX
Ok thanks for the reply! Glad to hear it's not dead yet. I like to do landscape and used to get good results with Fuji velvia a long time ago.

WRITING.TITLE: Slide film question
WRITING.TEXT: I'm thinking about getting back to shooting some slide film and my local film processor is telling me they have discontinued making the development chemicals necessary for the E6 process. Is this true?

In 455 BC, Aeschylus, the great playwriter known as the Father of Greek Tragedy, died in a most unexpected way. He was said to have been killed by a tortoise which was dropped by an eagle that had mistaken his head for a rock suitable for shattering the shell of the reptile.

Been riding trails for 20 years...Never needed either one. I could see where you would need one if you were doing a lot of down hill. Do you currently have a problem with your chain popping off or bending you chainring on rocks or something? If not then I wouldn't worry about it.

I lived in Shreveport when hurricane Katrina hit. We had a massive influx of people into the area and we saw first hand the effects of the migrating population. We called them Katrina people because we noticed how all of the stores were trashed out after they showed up. The locals resented them and the refugees acted like they were entitled to more than they were provided with by the government. It was a bad situation all around.
I Flew for the Furher is a good read. It's from one of their fighter pilots. https://www.amazon.com/dp/B06XGR2BCX/ref=dp-kindle-redirect?_encoding=UTF8 btkr=1

I had this guy that worked for me in the military. Everyone knows not to be late or its your ass. This guy was an awesome worker, never had to worry if he was gonna get his shit done. He came in late a few times and couldn't explain why he couldn't wake up. Said he woke up with head aches and felt tired all the time. I had heard of sleep apnea and it sounded like he might have it. I told him to go get checked out and that was his problem. They gave him the mask to sleep with and he wasn't late again.
Not scared but thought it was a fart...Recently.

Going outside to play. I grew up in the country out in the woods and the neighbor kids would all come over to play with me and my brothers. We would take the dog and go bird hunting with our pellet guns or shotgun. Have sniper shot contests. Build forts and play war. Put on our camo and face paint then go on recon patrols to the neighbors house. Kill frogs in every imaginable way...Yes we had fire crackers and an electricity generator. Catch snakes and have the dog kill them.

I put it as far back as it goes and stretch my legs out under the person's seat in front of me. Sometimes I have to kick their under seat bag over to one side but they don't even know. I also stuff their seat back pocket with my stuff and constantly raise and lower my tray. If it's dark I'll turn on MY light so I can read my book. If my neighbor is not using their air I'll steal it by pointing it at myself when they aren't looking. Sometimes I quietly let a fart slip and fan it away. I always get a window seat and never offer to trade to anyone. I ask for extra drinks when mine runs out.

My grandfather grew up during the depression and he told me that it's not what you want to do in life, it's what you can do. That's all he said but I take it to mean that not everyone is meant to be a doctor or a lawyer or even go to college. It's more about seeing the opportunities around you and acting upon them.

Whoa there buddy, I eat the aforementioned food items on a regular basis and I am not suffering the effects of diabetes or obesity. Maybe you are eating too much? Next time don't get the super size shake and maybe go with the kid size. It's about the amount of calories you consume and hence burn. Ideally to lose weight you intake less calories than you use in one day. Conversely, to gain weight you of course eat more than you burn.

I didn't have a BEST friend in highschool. Allen smoked meth and still lives with his mom. Talked Nick out of suicide and now he's a truck driver. Rich went to jail for selling drugs, got out and joined the Army then got medical discharge. Rudy married Mindy (the hot girl). Never seen Bill again, heard he got some kids. Mike got new teeth and he is a truck driver. Craig inherited the grocery store when his dad died, still smokes weed 3 times a day. Different Nick molested his step daughter and got caught. Dennis is still in prison 20 years later. Jason works with my brother at the factory. Different Dennis joined the Marines (he wasn't my friend though). Todd finally got married to a bleeding heart liberal. Chucky is still a retard. Different Jason works at a shell station. As you can see my friends were fuck ups, that's why I joined the Air Force and got the fuck out of there.
